alert.note: Alert for Cotton (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 02 at 3:30AM CDT until June 03 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Deep Red Creek near Randlett affecting Cotton County.
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. OKC033-022030- /O.EXT.KOUN.FL.Y.0019.000000T0000Z-220603T1800Z/ /RNDO2.N.ER.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.NO/ 330 AM CDT Thu Jun 2 2022 ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Deep Red Creek near Randlett. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Some inundation of bottomlands may occur along and near the creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 12.0 feet. - Forecast...The Deep Red Creek is expected to rise to a crest of 17.9 feet this evening. - Action stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
